title: Republic Services, union reach deal to end trash strike
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The agreement resolves the weeks-long work stoppage that disrupted service for hundreds of thousands in the Boston area.
Dumpsters behind Johnny's Luncheonette in Newton, MA overflow with trash as workers continue to strike against waste collection company Republic Services.

Suzanne Kreiter/Globe Staff Previously: Republic Services and Teamsters Local 25 reached a deal Friday to end a trash strike that disrupted service for hundreds of thousands of customers across the Boston area for weeks.

title: Former Mass. national guardsman pleads guilty to child porn charges
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime The guilty plea comes nearly a year after Nicholas Wells was accused of distributing child pornography videos and chatting online about his interest in minors.
Nicholas Wells, 44, was formerly a master sergeant of the 102 Security Forces of the Massachusetts National Guard, stationed in Sandwich.

AP Photo/Steven Senne, File By Abby Patkin September 19, 2025 | 11:54 AM 1 minute to read A former master sergeant in the Massachusetts National Guard pleaded guilty in federal court this week to possessing and sharing child sexual abuse materials, some of which reportedly involved infants.

title: Duxbury residents speak out over proposed ‘battery farm’ in residential neighborhood
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Developers are returning with a proposal to build a 5 MW battery storage facility, despite being turned down twice by the town.
The residents are not happy.
A sign reading "Stop Lithium Battery Farms in Residential Zones" in Duxbury.

title: Celtics reportedly ‘very happy’ with work Jayson Tatum has put in this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update Tatum has reportedly remained in Boston for nearly the entire offseason as the Celtics star rehabs from an Achilles injury.
Jayson Tatum tore his Achilles in the Celtics' second-round playoff loss to the Knicks.
(AP Photo/Frank Franklin II) By Conor Roche September 19, 2025 | 10:57 AM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Watch: Jon Stewart unveils ‘government-approved’ Daily Show in wake of Kimmel flap
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Politics "We have another fun, hilarious, administration-compliant show.
" ShareSend this article to your social connections.

Kimmel Suspended: Late-night shows address Jimmy Kimmel suspension with humor and solidarity Reactions to ABC’s pulling of ‘Kimmel’ reflect America’s partisan divide ABC suspends Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show indefinitely over his remarks about Charlie Kirk’s death In the wake of talk show host Jimmy Kimmel’s suspension by ABC — ostensibly over comments he made in the wake of the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk — Jon Stewart made a special Thursday-night appearance on “The Daily Show.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Quizzes Cardi B, Dua Lipa, and Josh Kraft make strange bedfellows in this week’s news quiz.

Collage of Cardi B (left), Dua Lipa (middle), and Josh Kraft (right) Frazer Harrison, Brent Goldman/TD Garden, Suzanne Kreiter/Globe Staff By Peter Chianca September 19, 2025 | 5:00 AM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Do you stay in the loop with the local news?

title: Charlie Kirk vigil draws thousands to Boston Common, ends suddenly due to safety concerns, organizer says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News "That's exactly why we needed to do it, because you can't speak your mind in Massachusetts without fear of being hurt.
" Pamela Blyakhman of Revere, left, and Sharon Tamagna of Merrimack during a vigil in support of slain far-right activist Charlie Kirk at Boston Common on Thursday, September 18, 2025.
Ken McGagh for The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Can Bruins’ Morgan Geekie prove that his 33-goal season wasn’t an outlier?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "I felt like I hit rock bottom pretty early, at least mentally, and and got stuck there.
" Morgan Geekie is expected to be one of the key cogs up front for Boston this season.

Ken McGagh for The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 18, 2025 3 minutes to read A candid Morgan Geekie didn’t mince words on Thursday when asked about the sizable expectations placed on his shoulders this season.

title: Video: 2 humpback whales breach right next to N.H. fishermen
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News “Dude, dude, this isn’t good.
” Two mariners on Tuesday nearly had their boat capsized by a breaching humpback whale.
Dale Sprague Two fishermen had an unexpected close call with two humpback whales while fishing off the coast of New Hampshire on Tuesday, an encounter that was captured on video.

title: Aaron Rodgers recalls ‘1 of the greatest plays’ he’s seen playing Patriots at Gillette Stadium
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "There may have been a few of us on the sideline who had a very tiny, quiet 'go' on that play.
" Aaron Rodgers is 0-2 in games started at Gillette Stadium.
Jim Davis/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 18, 2025 2 minutes to read Gillette Stadium has served as a house of horrors for Aaron Rodgers and the Steelers over the years.
